result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Notice of Case Acceptance to First Offender Program

[ma//no record made] No Appearance by Defendant Veridiany Garcia Garcia OR Attorney Sylvie Dahnert.  Jeffrey Martin Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.
The Clerk has been informed that Ms. Garcia has been accepted into FOP. The Court sets a calendar call to await the submission of documents. 

NEXT: Calendar Call on 5/23/22 at 8:30am
Status conference on April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Consent to Act
Status conference on April 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Attorney Dahnert, CC: DA, Def, Atty Dahnert ae 2/4/22
Final Statement of service hours in the amount of 1.1 hours submitted by contract Attorney Huebner.

[MK] case called at 11:32am 
Defendant Veridiany Garcia Garcia appears. Attorney Karl Huebner appears. DA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Shawna Stevenoski is sworn as Spanish Interpreter.  
The Court finds that the Zoom video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 
Attorney Huebner raises that Ms. Garcia has expressed angst regarding not having a bilingual attorney; she feels she would be able to communicate better and avoid added expense if she would have a bilingual attorney appointed for her.  
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Pleas of  "not guilty" are entered; speedy trial is waived by both parties. The Defense reserves the right to re-raise the speedy trial request.  
The Court finds probable cause to exist in the Criminal Complaint.
As to the bilingual counsel concern raised, the Court directs the appointment of Attorney Sylvie Dahnert to represent the Defendant.  
recess 11:43am 

NEXT: (1) Appointment of Attorney Sylvie Dahnert as successor counsel for the Defendant, (2) Status Conference on April 1st at 11:30am

Karl Huebner
Ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner, Def (1/25/22--ma)
Scheduling Order
Initial appearance on February 3, 2022 at 11:30 am.

Order on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney 
The Court orders repayment at the rate of $100/month until the total sum is paid; beginning 3/15/2022 & payments shall be made to the Clerk of Courts by the 15th of every month thereafter. 
Ec/pc: DA, Atty Huebner, Def (1/25/22--ma)

[ma] Case called at 1:53pm [All Appearances via Zoom]
Defendant Veridiany Garcia Garcia appears.   Melanie Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter.
Shawna Stevenoski sworn as Spanish Interpreter

The Court maintains the $150 cash bond, adds conditions: 
--no acts or threats of violence
--no violent contact with Victim 1
--Defendant is to report to the Jefferson County Clerk of Courts Office to sign this Bond by 1/20/22 at noon

recess: 2:02pm 


NEXT:  Initial Appearance on 2/3/22 at 11:30am via zoom
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
